intro: Galarhoeus commutatus, commonly known as the variable spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open grasslands. Its leaves are alternate and have a rough texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Galarhoeus commutatus is adapted to arid environments and is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
